item.title: Deep Learning with AWS
item.description: Update: I recommend reading Nvidia’ GPU Server Application Deployment Made Easy for an alternative approach (Ansible) to setting up the NVDIA-Docker plugin. There are many tutorials on how to leverage Amazon’s supreme computing power to perform deep learning tasks. I would like to take this opportunity to contribute to that collection. I started working with Amazon’s EC2 instances for deep learning by reading some of these tutorials, including predominantly: Installing CUDA, OpenCL, and PyOpenCL on AWS EC2 Deep Learning Tutorial for Kaggle’s Facial Keypoints Detection Installing TensorFlow on AWS I would launch an instance, install the necessary dependencies and create an AMI.
